metadata.intent: Establish master definition for character 'CLIENT ENTERTAINING OUTFIT'
metadata.rationale: Extracted from canonical script and scene co-occurrence data.

data.description: The 'CLIENT ENTERTAINING OUTFIT' is not a character in the traditional sense but rather a specific ensemble selected for Dante during her makeover at Saks Fifth Avenue. It is a provocative yet deliberately curated look chosen and approved by Cassandra Constantine, intended to signal Dante's new role as a broker who entertains clients. The outfit is described as making Dante look like a 'high-end prostitute,' reflecting Cassandra's calculated and transactional worldview regarding professional appearance and client relations.
data.dialogue_summary: The 'CLIENT ENTERTAINING OUTFIT' is referenced in a single line of dialogue spoken by Cassandra: 'CLIENT ENTERTAINING OUTFIT. MEMORIZE THIS.' This command, delivered mid-phone-call, underscores Cassandra's authoritative and transactional approach to Dante's professional development, treating the outfit as a mandatory uniform with strategic purpose.

explicit_evidence.quote: Dante comes out with her final make-over and truly looks like a high-end prostitute.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: EXT. SAK'S FIFTH AVE FRONT ENTRANCE - CONTINUOUS
EXT. SAK'S FIFTH AVE FRONT ENTRANCE - CONTINUOUS

explicit_evidence.quote: Cassandra is there, on the phone the entire time, approving or disapproving everything. All that she approves would be considered incredibly provocative.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: EXT. SAK'S FIFTH AVE FRONT ENTRANCE - CONTINUOUS
explicit_evidence.trait: Approved by Cassandra as part of a controlled image overhaul

inferred_traits.rationale: Cassandra selects, approves, and commands Dante to memorize the outfit, treating it as a tool of professional conditioning rather than personal expression.
inferred_traits.value: The outfit represents Cassandra's dominance over Dante's identity and professional persona

inferred_traits.rationale: The narrative explicitly describes the look as resembling a 'high-end prostitute,' suggesting the outfit is meant to leverage Dante's appearance for business purposes.
inferred_traits.value: The outfit encodes a specific role for Dante in client entertainment, blurring professional and sexual presentation

inferred_traits.rationale: Dante's decision to burn her old clothes and embrace the new wardrobe signals a complete shedding of her prior identity, with the client entertaining outfit as the centerpiece of that change.
inferred_traits.value: The outfit marks Dante's transition from her old self to a new, curated professional identity

data.name: CLIENT ENTERTAINING OUTFIT

relationships.evidence: Cassandra selects and commands Dante to memorize the outfit, using it as an instrument of professional conditioning.
relationships.relationship_type: Tool of control and image management

relationships.evidence: Dante wears the outfit as part of her makeover transformation, signaling her new role at the firm.
Liliane dresses Dante in the outfit as part of the Saks Fifth Avenue makeover montage.

scene_presence: EXT. SAK'S FIFTH AVE FRONT ENTRANCE - CONTINUOUS
